BR_text.BRsummary: nan values break dictionaries in streamlit
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
 
 Dictionary objects with nan values return syntaxerror
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33131958/94056656-74cf8b80-fd93-11ea-9bb6-bb44718c60d9.png></denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
 Minimum viable code snippet with a working dictionary and a non-working dictionary
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33131958/94056685-7c8f3000-fd93-11ea-99e1-2392a8aff5e5.png></denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 I would expect that the dictionary object would allow nan values.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 Actual behavior is syntax error
 <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
 
 No
 <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Streamlit version: 0.66.0
 Python version: 3.7
 Using Conda
 OS version: Windows 10
 Browser version: Chrome

comments_0.comment_text:
Fixed as part of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/2282>#2282</denchmark-link>
  and will be available in 0.71.0.
